Docs.param: A comma-delimited <xref:System.String> value that represents the metrics for the character.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by specifying the metrics as a string.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `metrics` parameter is a comma-delimited string that specifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics> properties in the following order:
- <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxWidth%2A>
- <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxHeight%2A>
- <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.Baseline%2A>
- <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.LeftSideBearing%2A>
- <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.RightSideBearing%2A>
- <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.TopSideBearing%2A>
- <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BottomSideBearing%2A>
The first two properties, <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxWidth%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxHeight%2A>, are required. However, the other five properties are optional, and will default to zero if not specified. For example, if you specify the string value of "0.75,0.75,,0.1" for the `metrics` parameter, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxWidth%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxHeight%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.LeftSideBearing%2A> properties are setâ€”the unspecified properties are set to zero.

Docs.summary: Gets the baseline value for the character.
Docs.value: A value of type <xref:System.Double> representing the baseline.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The return value represents the vertical offset from the bottom of the black box to the baseline. A positive value indicates the baseline is above the bottom of the black box, while a negative value indicates the baseline is below the bottom of the black box.

Docs.summary: Gets the height of the black box for the character.
Docs.value: A value of type <xref:System.Double> representing the black box height.

Docs.summary: Gets the width of the black box for the character.
Docs.value: A value of type <xref:System.Double> representing the black box width.

Docs.summary: Gets the recommended white space below the black box.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A negative value indicates an overhang. The vertical advance for the character is the sum of the property values <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.TopSideBearing%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.CharacterMetrics.BlackBoxHeight%2A>, and BottomSideBearing. The vertical advance cannot be less than zero.
